alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 2:19PM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches, with localized higher amounts possible away from Lake Champlain. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Champlain Valley of Vermont and New York. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult, especially during the Monday morning commute. Scattered to numerous power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain overnight is expected to change over to heavy, wet snow during the pre-dawn hours on Monday. Snowfall rates on Monday morning will likely exceed 1 inch per hour. Furthermore, gusty northwest winds 20 to 30 mph could produce additional power outages on Monday afternoon into Monday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
